content.body: `JSON.parse` does an `IsCallable` check on `reviver` before passing it to `InternalizeJSONProperty`, but `InternalizeJSONProperty` types that argument as "a function object"
content.formatted_body: JSON.parse does an IsCallable check on reviver before passing it to InternalizeJSONProperty, but InternalizeJSONProperty types that argument as "a function object"

content.body: esmeta rightfully complains because those types don't match up
ðŸ¤” though it's strange that it wouldn't complain about the same thing with `Function.prototype.bind` and `BoundFunctionCreate`...
content.formatted_body: ðŸ¤” though it's strange that it wouldn't complain about the same thing with Function.prototype.bind and BoundFunctionCreate...

content.body: it's possible that it's already skipping one of those for some other reason, I'll take a look
btw this would be easier if someone stamped https://github.com/tc39/ecma262/pull/3651 and we merged it
